newsitem.title: FINLAND: Enso in talks to buy German group - paper. [CORRECTED 07:55 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Enso in talks to buy German group - paper. [CORRECTED 07:55 GMT]

text.p: Finnish forestry group Enso Oy is in talks to buy German paper-maker E. Holtzmann AG, daily Helsingin Sanomat reported on Friday.
"The state forestry group Enso is negotiating to buy the German newsprint and magazine paper manufacturer E. Holtzmann AG," Helsingin Sanomat said.
The price asked for the German firm was 1.3 billion German marks, or almost four billion Finnish markka, the paper said.
"The negotiations on the corporate acquisition are in the final stretch as Enso's exclusive right to negotiate for Holzmann ends at the beginning of May," the paper said.
Helsingin Sanomat gave no source for the reported acquisition plans.
Holtzmann, based in Karlsruhe, has annual net sales of three billion markka (corrects from German marks) and 1,600 employees, the newspaper said.
Its main owner, with four-fifths of shares, is publishing group Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung (WAZ), Helsingin Sanomat said.
By acquiring Holtzmann, Enso could boost its annual newsprint production capacity to 1.1 million tonnes.
In 1996, Enso produced 857,000 tonnes of newsprint, according to the company's annual report.
In addition to newsprint, Holtzmann makes uncoated super-calendered (SC) magazine paper, the paper said.
